name: Great Glen Way - alternative via Carb na Leitire

ai.summary: A 7.9 km, moderate section of the Great Glen Way via the Carb na Leitire route. This shorter, scenic leg in Scotland combines lochside views with grassy tracks and light forested sections, suitable for hikers with intermediate fitness seeking a manageable yet rewarding day on the trail.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly grassy paths and compact dirt tracks with occasional gentle ascents. Expect some muddy patches, rocky or rooty spots near forest edges, and exposed sections along the loch offering panoramic views.
ai.safety_notes: Weather in Scotland can change rapidly; check the forecast before setting out. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and bring a waterproof layer. Stay on marked paths and carry a map and compass or a reliable GPS device, as some signs may be sparse. Mobile reception can be limited along parts of the route; inform someone of your plan and expected return. Carry enough water and snacks, and pace yourself to avoid fatigue, especially in windy or damp conditions. In winter, daylight is short and conditions can be icy or flooded.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Hat and gloves (even in mild weather)
Map and compass or GPS device
Fully charged mobile phone with offline maps
Small first-aid kit and blister care
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (May–September) offer the best conditions. The route can be tackled year-round with appropriate gear, but winter carries short daylight and potentially harsher weather.
